intro: Astragalus paucifoliolatus, commonly known as the few-leaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant species native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Astragalus paucifoliolatus is adapted to harsh environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and deep root systems to access water. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
